p: In addition to the antigen recognition system, innate immune cells, including natural killer (NK) cells [ 43], mast cells [ 5], and macrophages [ 8] can also be activated and produce immune response when host tissues are infected by parasites. Reports have shown that if the expression levels of genes related to the activation and receptor recognition of these cells are upregulated, this may promote phagocytosis [ 37], killing of parasites [ 43] and inflammatory response [ 20] of hosts, and result in stronger resistance to parasites.
